page.title: 07Old Buildings in Milnathort
page.content: Milnathort Town Hall was opened in 1855. As well as serving the needs of the community, which it still does (from badminton to coffee mornings),it had then a police post and cells. Milnathort had a thriving 19th c. weaving community and a much older meal and flour milling trade. The smiddy in Wester Loan was once a weav- er's cottage, and the old mill still stands in the centre of the village. Just outside Milanthort is{Burleigh {Castle (photograph B) }This red sand- stone 15th c. castle used to have a moat. In the summer tourists from this country and abroad visit the castle. Local children often play round it. The castle is said to be haunted by a ghost called "Grey Maggie". Two ancient standing stones (3000 to 4000 yrs old) are in a field at Orwell Farm, 4km from Milnathort.
